snippet: The operation is a part of a five-year-old “pacification” policing program, which has established permanent police patrols in select slums in Rio de Janeiro ahead of this year’s World Cup tournament.
abstract: About 2,700 members of Brazil’s security forces occupy a slum complex that sits along two highways connecting Rio de Janeiro's international airport to its main tourist zone; operation is part of five-year-old pacification policing program ahead of World Cup soccer tournament, which Brazil will host.
lead_paragraph: The operation is a part of a five-year-old “pacification” policing program, which has established permanent police patrols in select slums in Rio de Janeiro ahead of this year’s World Cup tournament.

headline.main: Brazil Sends In Armed Forces to Assist in Policing Poor Area
headline.print_headline: Brazil Sends In Armed Forces to Assist in Policing Poor Area
